intro: Nassauvia intermedia, commonly known as the desert honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 1 to 3 feet, with woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive and hardy plant for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
